name: Saratoga Arms

reviews.text: Loved the Saratoga Arms. My Experience there was delightful, pleasant and relaxing. My trip to Saratoga Spring was unexpected and I had no knowledge of the area so I had to depend on the staff for directions, restaurants and as well as sights to see and things to do. The staff there was very knowledgeable of the area and very helpful in all aspects of my stay. The location of the hotel could not have been any better. Being on Broadway gave me the ability to park my car on Saturday and not have to move it again until we left on Monday morning. Everything was within walking distance. Relaxing on the front porch and watching the town go about its business was the most relaxing part of the whole weekend. I would highly recommend the Saratoga Arms hotel to anyone staying in Saratoga Springs. Great place. Good people and accommodations were better that most major hotel chains (Sheraton’s, Radisson’s, Hyatt’s, etc). The ambiance of the place only added to its character and made the stay that much more enjoyable. If you are planning to stay in Saratoga Springs, The Saratoga Arms is well worth it. Both my wife and I plan on staying there again when we get another chance to go back there. .
reviews.title: Perfect place to stay in Saratoga Springs

reviews.text: Every last detail of our stay was perfect, from the immaculate room and surroundings to the delicious breakfasts! We were especially impressed with the friendliness and helpfulness of the entire staff and the quiet room and hallways. We particularly enjoyed our chats on the front porch with Kathleen, the owner. A wonderful way to pamper ourselves and relax! Donna S.

reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Saratoga Arms for one Saturday last September, while in town for a wedding and had a very pleasant stay. The staff was wonderful -- everyone was attentive, helpful, and warm. The decor was clean, beautiful, and elegant without being overly frilly foo-foo like so many of the other hotels and b&b's in the area. Our room was in the back in a new section of the hotel. Our room was spacious and well-appointed, and the beds were very, very comfortable. We had asked for a room in the back hoping that that it would be quiet, and quiet it was! The breakfast they served us was a REAL breakfast -- eggs and potatoes made-to-order and a buffet of other goodies. I'm a very picky eater, and I can tell you, it was delicious! They also have muffins and coffee available at the front for a snack when you need it. I loved having coffee out on the front porch and watching the passers-by. And it was fun to be able to step out the door and be in the middle of all the downtown shops and restaurants. If I return to Saratoga Springs, I know this is where I want to stay!!

reviews.text: The Saratoga Arms is a beautiful bed and breakfast in the heart of downtown Saratoga. The charm and appeal of the hotel is further exemplified by the hotel staff. They truly make you feel as if they are working for you and are always available and thinking ahead about what you will need next. Any problems that arose were taken care of quickly and in a professional manner. Each attendee walked away raving about the bed and breakfast and what downtown Saratoga has to offer.

The first thing that hit me as I entered my room was the decor and cleanliness. I have never seen a hotel so clean and, more importantly, well maintained. The room had a glass chandelier that was devoid of ANY dust.

CFC's are one of my most favorite items and the Arms, does not seem to use them even in the common spaces.

reviews.text: The Saratoga Arms was recommended to us by friends in our town that have family in the Saratoga Springs area. It was a great recommendation. My wife and I decided to take a weekend getaway and knew nothing about Saratoga Springs. We relied on our friends recommendation as to where to book our room and it was a winner. The location is fantastic;right in the heart of this small charming city within walking distance of everything. The room accommodations were impeccably clean. The staff was very pleasant and helpful in their service and suggestions as to where to visit and dine. The owners themselves were available during the daytime to make sure everything was satisfactory in every way and detail. We highly recommend this "Concierge Hotel" as a MUST STAY for anyone wishing to visit this charming city.
reviews.title: the place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Saratoga Arms - and will definitely return for another relaxing long weekend! Our room was very charming, with old-world furnishings and atmosphere, yet it had all the modern conveniences, including Wifi, central a/c, etc. The entire staff is exceptional - friendly, accommodating, and very helpful. I especially appreciated their assistance with getting a birthday cake delivered to our room - and at the exact right time! The breakfast, which was included with the room, was also wonderful each morning. The town is charming, with many excellent restaurants, sites and beautiful parks within easy walking distance of the Saratoga Arms. I would recommend this small hotel - and the town - to anyone who wants a quiet, relaxing weekend. Thanks to the staff of Saratoga Arms for a much-needed, restful stay.

reviews.text: We had a board meeting at the Saratoga Arms, and also an Advisory Council meeting during the same week. Everything for three solid days went off without even one glitch. The meeting room was perfect for our board meeting with nine people and also perfect when the group increased to 26 people. It has a built-in LCD projector, tables that work well either as a board table or as a U shape for larger groups, and windows for natural light. Staff at the Saratoga Arms were always on top of everything and we felt extremely well taken care of.
